Class ObjectiveReportingRegime

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.DelegatedRegime
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.ObjectiveReportingRegime
All Implemented Interfaces:
Regime
@Strategy(CONCRETE) public class ObjectiveReportingRegime extends DelegatedRegime
A Regime decorator that wraps another training regime and reports the objective (loss) value at each epoch.

This class is typically used for debugging or monitoring: it computes the aggregated loss before the first epoch (baseline) and after each epoch, then prints the results if dump is enabled. It also tracks the relative improvement between epochs.

Improvement Sign Convention

The reported relative improvement is expressed as a percentage change in loss compared to the previous epoch:
  • A negative value means the loss decreased (improved).
  • A positive value means the loss increased (worsened).

Thread Safety

This class is not thread-safe. Create a new instance per training run or call reset() if you want to reuse the same instance across runs.
See Also:

    • ObjectiveReportingRegime

      public ObjectiveReportingRegime(Regime regime, boolean dump)
      Creates a new reporting regime that wraps the given regime.
      Parameters:
      regime - the underlying training regime to delegate to
      dump - whether to print loss values and improvement at each epoch

  • Method Details

    • create

      @StaticFactory public static ObjectiveReportingRegime create(Regime regime)
      Creates a new reporting regime that wraps the given regime.
      Parameters:
      regime - the underlying training regime to delegate to

    • isDumpingLossValues

      public boolean isDumpingLossValues()
      Returns whether this regime is currently printing loss values.
      Returns:
      true if reporting is enabled, false otherwise

    • setDumpingLossValues

      public void setDumpingLossValues(boolean dump)
      Enables or disables reporting of loss values.
      Parameters:
      dump - true to enable reporting, false to disable

    • train

      public <E extends EstimationFunction> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective, Optimizer<? super E> optimizer)
      Trains the given estimation function using the wrapped regime and reports the aggregated loss before and after training.

      On the first epoch, the baseline aggregated loss is computed before any updates. After each epoch, the new aggregated loss is computed, the relative improvement is calculated, and results are printed if reporting is enabled.

      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of estimation function
      Parameters:
      estimationFunction - the model to train
      trainingSet - the dataset to train on
      objective - the loss function to evaluate
      optimizer - the optimizer to update parameters

    • getRelativeImprovement

      public Float getRelativeImprovement()
      Returns the relative improvement in aggregated loss compared to the previous epoch.

      For example, if epoch N yields a loss of 10 and epoch N+1 yields a loss of 5, this method returns -50.0f. If the loss increases, the returned value will be positive.

      Returns:
      the relative improvement percentage, or null if no training has happened yet

    • getCurrentLoss

      public Float getCurrentLoss()
      Returns the aggregated loss from the most recent epoch.
      Returns:
      the last aggregated loss value, or null if no training has happened yet

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets this reporting regime so it can be reused for a new training runs. This clears the iteration count, current loss, and improvement history.
